ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:0.5_0: 52. The training rule on licking the hands
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were licking their hands while eating. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not lick my hands while eating,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:1.4_0: he should not eat licking his hands;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, licks his hands while eating, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:1.7.1_0: or it has not been trusted ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:1.9_0: The second rule, the second training rule on fire, is finished.
